page.title: 12The Five Rise Locks, Bingley
page.content: The Five Rise Locks on the Leeds-Liverpool Canal were designed by John Longbotham and opened in 1774. They have changed very little since they were built by four local stonemasons. The locks are built in "staircase" formation and raise the canal 60ft. It takes about 30mins to pass through them in narrow boats. The canal is used today mainly by pleasure boats and as many as thirty boats may pass through the locks in a day. Two large pleasure boats operate regularly. Apollo, a traditional narrow boat carries up to 48 people and the Water Prince 78. Both boats can be hired for private parties. The Local Council run a 'water-bus' service during the summer months between Shipley and Bingley with several bus-stops along the route.
